results.title: Jesus' son [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Alliance Atlantis, Blue Sky Studios, Evenstar, Elizabeth Cutherell, Lydia Dean Pilcher, David Urrutial, Margot Bridger and Alison MacLean
results.brief_description: Based on Denis Johnson’s acclaimed gritty short story collection, also called “Jesus’ Son”, this a finely observed drama about a young man’s descent into heroin abuse and small-time criminality in the early seventies. Faithfully recreating the drug subculture of the time, and also utilising a loose narrative structure and mise-en-scene that recalls the daring independent work of early 1970s American cinema, “Jesus’ Son” features a rich array of characters who are by turn tragic and comic. Billy Crudup and Samantha Morton are excellent as two young lovers working out their shared dependency on each other and on heroin, and they are well supported by a supporting cast that includes Holly Hunter, Denis Leary and Dennis Hopper. Though the material is harsh and confronting, “Jesus’ Son” also emerges as a deeply optimistic and humane drama. This is an excellent example of a film work that remains true to the mood and emotional intensity of its original source text, but which also creatively re-imagines and develops the story for another medium.

results.title: Jessye Norman: Singer
results.creator_credit: Arts Council of Great Britain, BBC-TV, Harvey Kass and Cathy Palmer
results.brief_description: The full range and diversity of Jessye Norman’s singing is captured on film at performances in London, Paris and New York. Examples of these performances shown are the role of Ariadne in Strauss’ Ariadne auf Naxos, and the lament from Purcell’s Dido and Aeneas. Jessye also comments on her cultural roots and evolution as a singer.

results.title: Jessye Norman Sings Carmen
results.creator_credit: Antenne-2, BBC, La Sept, Nederlandse Omroep Stichting, Philips Classics, Radio France, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, Susan Froemke and Peter Gelb
results.brief_description: Featuring highlights from the Philips Classics/Radio France recording of Bizet’s “Carmen”, with Jessye Norman (Carmen), Neil Shicoff (Don Jose), Simon Estes (Escamillo), Radio Chorus France, and National Orchestra of France. Filmed by Albert Maysles and Martin Schaer.

results.title: Jessye Norman's Christmastide
results.brief_description: In Ely Cathedral, diva Jessye Norman sings this moving collection of Christmas songs, backed by the American Boychoir, Ely Cathedral Choristers, Vocal Arts Chorus and the Bournemouth Symphony Orchestra. The songs featured are “O Come, O Come Emmanuel”, “Once in Royal David’s City”, “Unto Us a Child is Born”, “Hark! the Herald Angels Sing”, “Good Christian Men Rejoice”, “O Holy Night”, “The Holly and the Ivy”, “See Amid the Winter Snow”, “I Saw Three Ships”, “Jessye’s Carol”, “Coventry Carol”, “In the Bleak Midwinter”, and “Silent Night”.

results.title: Jerusalem: within these walls
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society, WQED and Miriam Birch
results.brief_description: Narrated by Christopher Plummer, this program offers a kaleidoscopic view and history of the city which is an important centre for three of the world’s great religions - Judaism, Christianity and Islam. The old city is divided into four quartes - Christian, Muslim, Jewish and Armenian, where about 26,000 people live. The video profiles residents of old Jerusalem including a Jewish family of Yemeni jewellers; a Belgian refugee from Nazism; a Muslim artisan and television performer, Halil; Father Timothy, private secretary to the Greek Orthodox patriarch and finally, an Armenian Christian, survivor of Turkish oppression, who now works as a photographer.

results.title: Jerusalem: the Holy City
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, F Keller and E Keller
results.brief_description: Concentrating on the historic settings and contemporary shrines of the respective religions, this film develops the theme of Jerusalem as a city sacred to the Jewish, Christian and Islamic faiths. Settings and structures rich in historic association are shown.

results.title: Jerry Maguire (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gracie Films, James L. Brooks and Cameron Crowe
results.brief_description: Jerry Maguire set Hollywood abuzz in 1996 because it seemed to represent a return to films about people. Jerry Maguire (Tom Cruise) is a sports agent who starts to re-evaluate his success driven life. During a conference Jerry writes out a mission statement under a storm of inspiration, distributing it to everyone. When he gets back to work he discovers he’s been sacked and is left with only one client, Rod Tidwell (Cuba Gooding Jr) and one loyal employee, Dorothy Boyd (Renee Zellweger). Now Jerry has to struggle for his survival both as a sports agent and in his personal life as he is drawn into the lives of Dorothy and her son Ray (Jonathan Lipnicki). Cameron Crowe wrote and directed this heart warming romantic comedy which has lots to say about the commerce driven world we live in. Cuba Gooding Jr received and Oscar for Best Supporting Actor (1997) and Tom Cruise received a Golden Globe Award (1997) for Best Actor in a Comedy/Musical.

results.title: Jerry Hall yogacise
results.brief_description: Yogacise is an effective combination of yoga and exercise that firms and tones muscles as well as improving mental health. The program uses techniques from over 2,000 years ago and aims to improve the mind, body and soul, thus contributing to a good feeling both internally and in ones projection to the outside world.

results.title: Jericho
results.creator_credit: Buckingham, Walter Futter and Thornton Freeland
results.brief_description: In France 1917, heroic corporal Jericho Jackson accidently kills his abusive seargent. He is charged with the murder but escapes from military prison leaving his friend Captain Mack behind to face a five year prison sentence after being accused of assisting his escape. When Captain Mack is released in 1922, he vows to track down and capture Jericho who has by this time has made a home for himself in North Africa, practicing medicine and uniting the disparate Arab tribes on the annual salt caravan. When Mack finally confronts Jericho, has difficulty destroying the life he has built. Stars Paul Robeson, Henry Wilcoxon, Wallace Ford, John Laurie, Princess Kouka. Paul Robeson sings several songs including ‘Brother are you going my way?’.
